Key Match Events: Kerry Carpenter hit a three-run homer to win Game 2.
Kerry Carpenter got hurt while rounding third and scoring in the sixth inning on Thursday night.
The Guardians rallied to win 5-4 and even the back-and-forth series.
Pre-Game Insights: Tigers manager A.J. Hinch gives the latest injury update on Kerry Carpenter, after he left Game 4 of the ALDS.
Hinch said the team is waiting to see how Carpenter's injury responds before making any lineup or roster decisions.
MLB changed the start time seven hours, moving first pitch from 8:08 p.m. to 1:08 p.m ET due to potential inclement weather.
Bligh Madris, who has been working out with other Detroit players in Toledo during the series, is with the Tigers and would be the likely replacement for Carpenter.
Post-Match Reflections: Hinch said his focus was only on finding a way to advance.
Tigers catcher Jake Rogers said he was sore but otherwise fine after being hit with two foul balls on the left hand in Thursday's game.
Miscellaneous Highlights: If the Tigers have to replace Carpenter on their roster, he would be ineligible if the team advances to play the New York Yankees in the ALCS.
